intro: Mitracarpus eichleri, commonly known as the Eichler's mitracarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
